key_points: Twitter locked President Donald Trump's account, demanding he remove three flagged tweets.
The action followed violent events at the U.S. Capitol, incited after Trump urged supporters to protest the Electoral College vote affirmation of Joe Biden's win.
A woman was shot and killed inside the Capitol during the unrest.
Trump's video message post-riot was hidden for violating Twitter's Civic Integrity policy.
Twitter's lock on Trump's account is temporary for 12 hours, contingent on the deletion of the flagged tweets.
The platform had previously flagged Trump's tweets for misinformation but had never locked his account.
Permanent suspension from Twitter could significantly impact Trump, who has 88.7 million followers and over 59,500 tweets.
The article asks readers for their opinion on Twitter's decision and Trump's responsibility for the Capitol riot.
Twitter's steps are part of ongoing efforts to combat misinformation.
The situation escalates the debate on freedom of speech and accountability on social media platforms.
